pp.project_start_description: Welcome to Sanofi Virtual Training Experience

ep.ssml: Start by transacting the stopper bag barcode into SAP

Welcome to Sanofi Line 7. 
Today you will learn the required steps to properly perform the Line 7 - Zone 3 intervention for the addition of stoppers.
Move the stopper bag to the stopper bag holder
Cut and remove the second layer of the bag
Align the half moons on the bag to the half-moons on the port. The bag mouth will then attach to the port magnets
Clean the bag using an IPA wipe.
Thoroughly wipe the exterior of the stopper bag unidirectionally, both the front and back, including all creases and folds
Grab scissors and cut the outermost layer of the bag

<speak>
Pull the lever on left, to open the port door. 
<break time="2s"/>
This process allows us to maintain a closed system and ensure
that no outside air enters into The RABS, preventing possible contamination
</speak>

Pull the lever on left, to open the port door. This process allows us to maintain a closed system and ensure
that no outside air enters into The RABS, preventing possible contamination
From the exterior of the RABS use gloved hand to extend the trunk through the IDC port, then massage the exterior of the bag to start the addition of stoppers slowly onto the chute
Pull the bag slowly, to aid the movement of stoppers through the port. Using glove 14, a technician may adjust the chute handle to allow stoppers to flow into both stopper bowls
Click on the highlighted items to learn more about each of them.
Great. Now you know the key items we will be dealing with in this course. Click back to head back to the previous section.
In this section, we are going to learn the process of intervention by watching a technician perform them on-site.

Use the control buttons at the bottom of the video to play, pause, or replay the video. 
Click on the button with the technician to head back to the home screen.
Start by transacting the stopper bag barcode into SAP
Clean the bag using an IPA wipe.
Thoroughly wipe the exterior of the stopper bag unidirectionally, both the front and back, including all creases and folds
Check for any stoppers that may prevent the bag from being attached completely
Lock the bag into the port by sliding the lock switch into lock position and push the green button to the left of the IDC port to start the vacuum.
Push the lever on right, down from neutral to open

<speak>
Pull the lever on left, to open the port door. 
<break time="2s"/>
This process allows us to maintain a closed system and ensure
that no outside air enters into The RABS, preventing possible contamination
</speak>
From the exterior of the RABS use gloved hand to extend the trunk through the IDC port, then massage the exterior of the bag to start the addition of stoppers slowly onto the chute

<speak>
Pull the bag slowly, to aid the movement of stoppers through the port. 
Using glove 14, a technician may adjust the chute handle to allow stoppers to flow into both stopper bowls.
<break time="15s"/>
First air should not be violated over any stoppers throughout this operation to prevent contamination.
</speak>
Congratulations! You have now learned the complete process. Click back to head back to the previous section.
Welcome to section 1 of Practice It, Here, the entire setup has been arranged for you.
Here is a screen where each box is filled with a statement. These are hints, using which you will have to guess the item from the surrounding.
On being clicked, the correct item will be added to its respective placeholder on this screen. Good luck!
Congratulations! You have found all the items. Click back to head back to the previous section.
Move the stopper bag to the stopper bag holder
Cut and remove the second layer of the bag
Align the half moons on the bag to the half-moons on the port. The bag mouth will then attach to the port magnets
Check for any stoppers that may prevent the bag from being attached completely

<speak>
Lock the bag into the port by sliding the lock switch into lock position.
<break time= "4s"/>
Push the green button to the left of the IDC port to start the vacuum.
</speak>
Push the lever on right, down from neutral to open
Pull the bag slowly, to aid the movement of stoppers through the port. Using glove 14, a technician may adjust the chute handle to allow stoppers to flow into both stopper bowls

Now it’s your turn to apply what you have learned by 
performing this intervention on your own. All usable items 
have been arranged. Start by clicking on each item in a 
sequential order as per the steps of the last excercise.

If you get stuck, then click on the hint button. This will provide you with a hint for the next step in the process.
Time to get started. Good Luck!
Great! Now let us go ahead and start doing the next sequence.
Good start! You have used the barcode to transact the stopper bag into the SAP.
Great! Looks like you have cleaned the stopper bag well using the IPA wipe. Don't forget to clean both the front and back.
Nice! You managed to remove the outer layer of the bag using the scissors.
That's right. You have to move the stopper bag to the stopper bag holder to start the next steps.
Use this to transact the stopper bag into SAP.
Using this will remove contaminants on the stopper bag surface.
You need this to remove the outermost layer of the bag.
Place the stopper bag here to start the attaching sequence.
Alright. Now that you have moved the bag to the stopper bag holder, what's next?
Amazing! You cut & removed the second layer of the bag.
That’s correct! You will attach the bag’s mouthpiece to the IDC port. Now a quick question for you.
You need this to remove the second layer of the bag.
You attach this to the IDC port.
What do you have to align when attaching the mouthpiece of the bag to the IDC port?
Right! This is the correct answer!
Wrong! This is the correct answer!
Alright. Now that you have attached the bag to the IDC port, what do you do next?
Great! You have locked the bag into the port.
Amazing! You pushed the green button to start the vacuum.
That’s Correct! You have pushed the lever down from neutral to open.
Nice! You have now opened the port door by pulling the lever.
Great! You managed to extend the trunk through the IDC port. Now answer this final question.
You require this to keep the bag in place.
This will make sure to get rid of any extra air inside the chamber.
You need this to initiate the opening process.
This opens the inlet of the IDC port.
Do this to start the flow of the stoppers through the IDC port.
Move the stopper bag to the stopper bag holder
Grab scissors and cut the outermost layer of the bag
After alligning the half moons, what are you going to check for?
Right! This is the correct answer!
Wrong! This is the correct answer!
How will you aid the movement of stoppers through the port?
Right! This is the correct answer!
Wrong! This is the correct answer!
Congratulations! You have completed this section. Click back to head back to the previous section.
Welcome to this section. Here, you can learn about each step by clicking on the steps in this menu.
Congratulations! You have completed this section. Click back to head back to the previous section.
When you complete any step, that step will have a green check mark to indicate it’s completion.
This menu will be available in each scene. Look around to access it.

Let’s take a look at the training overview. This training is broken into 3 parts. Learn it, practice it and apply it. 
Click on each to know more about it.
In apply it, you will be tasked with performing the intervention without any guide. Let us proceed.

Under learn it, you will watch a video of the intervention being performed and familiarize yourself with the key items being used. 
Click on either to proceed.
Under practice it, you will familiarize yourself with all the items being used and follow a guided walk through of this intervention. Click on either to proceed.
Nice job, you completed the intervention. You can try any of the modules again by clicking on them.
